title: Is this sentence correct, 'He goes home on a bus'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Grammatically speaking, HE GOES HOME ON A BUS is not wrong But then, if you want to mean that he uses a bus as a means of transport to reach home, it is better to say HE GOES HOME by BUS. This construction HE GOES HOME ON A BUS suggests that he travels by sitting on the roof top of the bus - something which one would do, say, if one is desparate to take a particular bus and that all the seats of that bus already gets filled up / reserved by the time he arrives to take it !! So,, just look at the need of the context and decide on the appropriate preposition !!!

Tilak, hi. Preposition By is used when you wish to indicate the means by which you achieve something. In the given sentence going home is achieved by riding a bus. Conclusion: He goes home by a bus. Thanks and God bless.
